dt: {bc}to possess some of the attributes of a person, thing, or quality

dt.t: the individual man {wi}participates{/wi} in the ideal man

dt: {bc}to have a part or share in something

pt: {sc}share{/sc} {sc}participate{/sc} {sc}partake{/sc} mean to have, get, or use in common with another or others. {sc}share{/sc} usually implies that one as the original holder grants to another the partial use, enjoyment, or possession of a thing.
{sc}participate{/sc} implies a having or taking part in an undertaking, activity, or discussion.
{sc}partake{/sc} implies accepting or acquiring a share especially of food or drink.

et: Latin {it}participatus{/it}, past participle of {it}participare{/it}, from {it}particip-, particeps{/it} participant, from {it}part-, pars{/it} part + {it}capere{/it} to take {ma}{mat|heave:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to possess some of the attributes of a person, thing, or quality
